conclusion: Analyze the motion of the bullets and the carts.
Cart A is moving to the left with speed v1.
The speed of each bullet relative to the ground is v0 to the right.
The speed of the bullet relative to Cart A is v0 + v1 to the right.
Each bullet is fired at intervals of Δt0.
During the interval Δt0, Cart A moves a distance of v1 Δt0 to the left.
The bullet fired at time t will have traveled a distance of v0 Δt0 to the right relative to the ground.
The distance between two adjacent bullets in the air is the sum of the distance traveled by the first bullet and the distance Cart A has moved during Δt0.
The distance between two adjacent bullets is s = (v0 - v1) Δt0.
Cart B is moving to the right with speed v2.
The relative speed between the bullets and Cart B is v0 - v2.
The distance s between two adjacent bullets in the air is given by s = (v0 - v1) Δt0.
This formula accounts for the speed of the bullets relative to the ground and the motion of Cart A.
The speed of Cart B does not directly affect the distance between the bullets in the air.
